result.execSummary:
The defendant Elizabeth A Sutton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STRAIGHT TIME.
Apply 41 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Case 15CM1564, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No contact with Livetric K. or their residence.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant is to contact DOC by 09:00 a.m. on 10-01-2015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elizabeth A Sutton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Failure to Meet Conditions for Expungement filed by Department of Corrections.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Elizabeth A Sutton in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.

Defendant enter a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
41 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  15CM1564.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Concurrent to:  15CM1564
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with: Luvetric Kiedrowski or their residence.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
Defendant to contact DOC by 9:00 am. tomorrow 10/01/15.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court, defendant Elizabeth A Sutton not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Schleis waives his clients appearance.
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Dated September 1, 2015 filed by Attorney Weathers requesting that case 15CM1502 tag along with 15CM1564 and be scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.
09/02/15 - Court Reviewed - Request Granted - Matter to be tagged along with 15CM1564 on 09/09/15.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to not possess any prescriptions that are not her own.  Defendant to have no contact with Luvetric K.

Defendant Elizabeth A Sutton in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
